showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:50}); // â€œI heard a rumor
that the plate was going to fall,
crushing this station,
I've worked at so many years.â€{PAUSE}â€œBut I just can't bear to leave here.â€

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:49}); // â€œALL ABOARD!
The train is about to depart.â€

showWindowWithDialog({window:0, dialog:48}); // â€œMorning.
Dawn comes and things never change.â€{PAUSE}â€œYou be careful not to get hurt.
Come on back again, hear?â€
showWindowWithDialog({window:3, dialog:47}); // â€œFirst train leaves Midgar at 05:04am.â€

showWindowWithDialog({window:3, dialog:45}); // â€œThat's not to say that the crossing gate
of my heart doesn't hurt now and again.â€{PAUSE}â€œBack during the war, I remember there
was a lot of painful scenes then.â€

showWindowWithDialog({window:3, dialog:46}); // â€œBut, that's a story for
another dayâ€¦â€

showWindowWithDialog({window:3, dialog:44}); // â€œI wonder how long it's beenâ€¦
There's an invisible rail
between me and the passengers.â€{PAUSE}â€œI could never live their lives.
I'm just a train man plain and simple.
It's easier that way.â€

showWindowWithDialog({window:3, dialog:43}); // â€œWhen you've been a train man as long as I have,
you see a lot of people
and a lot of lives.â€{PAUSE}â€œPeople meeting, parting, joy, sadnessâ€¦
After a while,
it doesn't even get to you anymore.â€

dialogStrings: Sector 7 Station

{Barret}
â€œYo!!
Get over here, all'ya!!â€

{Barret}
â€œThis mission was a success.
But don't get lazy now.â€{PAUSE}â€œThe hard part's still to come!
Don't y'all be scared of that explosion!â€

{Barret}
â€œCause the next one's
gonna be bigger than that!â€

{Barret}
â€œMeet back at the hideout!!
Move out!â€

{Barret}
â€œYo, {Cloud}!
You lissen up!â€

{Barret}
â€œYo! What're ya doin' now?â€

Biggs
â€œuh, {Barret}â€¦
We, uhâ€¦â€

Wedge
â€œWe can't do it.
We just can't do it.â€

Jessie
â€œDon't worry!
Don't get all worried!â€

Jessie
â€œ{Cloud}!
Let's make the mission work!â€

Jessie
â€œ{Cloud}?
When this mission's overâ€¦â€{PAUSE}â€œWhy don't all of us take a long vacation.
Maybe we could go to a hot springs somewhere?
Yeahâ€¦
I don't knowâ€¦

{Cloud}
Yeahâ€¦
If I feel like it.

Jessie
Alrighty then!
It's a date!

{Cloud}
You never know what lies ahead.

Jessie
â€¦how lovely.
I might just have to tempt you, then.

{Barret}
Yo, you all done flappin' your gums!?
Go!
Get on that train!

{Tifa}
{Cloud}â€¦
Don't be so distant.
Everyone wants to be your friend.
I'm sureâ€¦

{Barret}
Damn, man!!
I'm here to fight!
Don't care 'bout bein' nobody's friend.

{Barret}
Let's go!
Don't be late!
{CHOICE}My husband never came back.{PAUSE}{CHOICE}I wonder if something happened to him?{PAUSE}{CHOICE}No, I'm sure his leave was just canceled.
{CHOICE}I went to the station everyday.{PAUSE}{CHOICE}Then, one dayâ€¦

{CHOICE}You used to see that kind of thing
{CHOICE}{CHOICE} a lot during the war.

Please take {Aeris} somewhere safe.
That's the last thing she said before she died.
My husband never came back, and I had no child.
I think I must have been very lonesome.
So I took {Aeris} home with me.
â€œI'm not letting you go tonight.â€
â€œWow!â€

â€œIsn't there somewhere
we could go to be alone?â€

â€œThere's only the train graveyard around here.
And they say there's ghosts around too!â€
â€œâ€¦damn.â€
â€œWhat?â€
â€œHey, come over here.â€
â€œBut people willâ€¦â€
â€œWho cares?â€

â€œButâ€¦
There's a weirdo over there.â€
â€œHuh?â€

â€œSay, you're pretty gutsy.â€{PAUSE}â€œWhy don't you go snoop somewhere
else, Romeo?â€
â€œI've had it!â€
â€œMe too.â€

â€œYou know this is the first time
we've ever agreed on something.â€
â€œYesâ€¦â€
â€œWell then, shall we?â€
â€œurgghâ€¦â€
â€œâ€¦huffâ€¦wheezâ€

â€œWhen you've been a train man as long as I have,
you see a lot of people
and a lot of lives.â€{PAUSE}â€œPeople meeting, parting, joy, sadnessâ€¦
After a while,
it doesn't even get to you anymore.â€

â€œI wonder how long it's beenâ€¦
There's an invisible rail
between me and the passengers.â€{PAUSE}â€œI could never live their lives.
I'm just a train man plain and simple.
It's easier that way.â€

â€œThat's not to say that the crossing gate
of my heart doesn't hurt now and again.â€{PAUSE}â€œBack during the war, I remember there
was a lot of painful scenes then.â€

â€œBut, that's a story for
another dayâ€¦â€
â€œFirst train leaves Midgar at 05:04am.â€

â€œMorning.
Dawn comes and things never change.â€{PAUSE}â€œYou be careful not to get hurt.
Come on back again, hear?â€

â€œALL ABOARD!
The train is about to depart.â€

â€œI heard a rumor
that the plate was going to fall,
crushing this station,
I've worked at so many years.â€{PAUSE}â€œBut I just can't bear to leave here.â€
